About.Name: Tracy Mai
About.AboutText:
Hi, My name is Tracy Mai. I am a passionate computer science student with a keen interest in software development and programming. Currently, I am pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University. I am dedicated to expanding my knowledge and skills in various areas of computer science, with a particular focus on C++ programming.

I enjoy tackling challenging programming projects and I thrive in collaborative environments where I can contribute my expertise and learn from my peers.

Beyond computer science, I actively engage in extracurricular activites related to my other passions in life such as Pup Support, a mental health organization focused on providing resources for college students. I also believe in continuous learning with the forever growing world of technology.

Experience.ExperienceText: Ever since university, I have been creating projects, each one teaching me new skills. Writing new programs and creating things just from typing is one of the greatest joys in my life. I want to continue onto to work in AI bias, to ensure that AI correctly solves human needs without overstepping its boundaries.
Experience.EducationText: Alongside my major, I am also minoring in Philosophy. Using a human-first perspective, I want to ensure that AI is used and created responsibly in the quick growing world of technology.
Experience.EmploymentText:
- Educates 12 students 6 hours per week to become innovative problem solvers and critical thinkers through private math sessions for 7-12 year olds upwards to ALgebra 2 whilst accomodating to each students' pace

- Maintains transparent parent communication through weekly emails, providing students' progress and addressing inquiries
Experience.SkillsText: In addition to my current skills, I am also getting certified with Microsoft's AI program.

Project1.Title: Water Tracker - A Computer Application and Pet to Help Meet Hydration Goals
Project1.Desc:
Users will meet their hydration goals by taking care of the pet. The more water they drink the more the pet will be happy.

This team consisted of 3 members and I worked as a full stack software developer.

Project2.Title: System Specification - ADA-Friendly Navigation App
Project2.Desc:
This navigation app is intended to help physically disabled people traverse through the world.

This is specification to help developers with building the ADAFNA.

Project3.Title: SEEN - A Bi-Directional American Sign Language APP
Project3.Desc:
This app was developed with a team of 5, with the goal of bridging the communication gap between deaf and hearing communities.

SEEN received the Top Oral Presentation Award at Seattle Pacific University's 2025 Erickson Conference.

I worked as the scrum master and software developer.

Project4.Title: Web Crawler
Project4.Desc:
A program that calculates various measurements based on a graph built to represent the connection of websites.

Calculates the All Pairs Shortest Path, Longest Path, Shortest Path, and Closeness Centrality.

Worked as a software developer in a team of two.

Project5.Title: Go -- Lexical and Syntax Analyzer
Project5.Desc:
A program that takes in coordinate points and shapes, and categorizes the tokens accordingly.

This was a solo project.
